gravity_system: Pre-Engineered Farm Trusses, Loadbearing Walls, Continuous Footings
key_elements: Moment Connections, Retaining Walls, Triple Wall Brace, Lintel Details
overall_building_description: The structural design of the Farm Commodity Storage building integrates a robust system of pre-engineered farm trusses spaced at 48 inches on center, providing a primary load path for roof loads. These trusses are supported by loadbearing walls constructed with 2x6 studs at 24 inches on center, reinforced with metal wall cladding and housewrap for environmental protection. The foundation system comprises continuous footings with 20 MPa concrete, reinforced with 15M rebar to ensure stability and load transfer to the undisturbed soil. The building's lateral stability is achieved through a combination of moment frames and X bracing, with moment connections detailed using L 4" x 3" x 3/8" steel angles and M20 bolts conforming to ASTM A325 standards. The connection details specify the use of shear tabs and base plates, with top plates fastened to steel beams using staggered 1/2-inch diameter bolts at 24 inches on center. The foundation walls, detailed as W1, W3, and W4, incorporate 25 MPa concrete with horizontal and vertical reinforcement to resist lateral earth pressures and support the superstructure. The retaining wall detail specifies a footing width of 4'-8" and a thickness of 12 inches, reinforced with six continuous 15M rebars and transversal bars at 16 inches on center. The roof assembly includes a 4/12 pitch with 29 ga metal roof cladding, supported by 2x4 strapping at 24 inches on center. Truss uplift clips are installed as per manufacturer drawings to mitigate wind uplift forces. The wall bracing system employs 2x6 diagonal braces with triple solid blocking, secured with 3 1/2-inch common spiral nails to ensure rigidity and prevent lateral displacement. The lintel schedule specifies W12X26 and W10X22 steel beams, with L3 lintels constructed from 2x10 members nailed to the bottom truss chord. The building's design adheres to the Ontario Building Code (OBC) requirements, with ridge venting and vented soffits incorporated for adequate ventilation. The construction sequence emphasizes the verification of all dimensions and the immediate reporting of discrepancies to maintain structural integrity. The assembly process includes the installation of pre-engineered trusses, followed by the erection of loadbearing walls and the placement of continuous footings. Temporary bracing is mandated during construction to maintain alignment and stability. The design also considers environmental factors, with provisions for backfilling using parent material to ensure proper drainage and soil compaction. The detailed specifications for each component, including material grades, bolt sizes, and reinforcement layouts, are meticulously documented to facilitate accurate fabrication and installation. The use of engineering jargon and precise terminology throughout the documentation ensures clarity and consistency in the execution of the structural design.
